> [{quoted}](name=FeBeast,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=HVXOfdEj,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-04-25T21:52:36.332+0000)

ftfy
You. I like you.

There's a subtle difference between "feeding" and "getting camped to hell and back by the jungler every time you get to lane."

"Yo top quit feeding them."
"How about you get off your ass and help get rid of this camping jungler?"
"......."
"Yeah that's what I thought."

*plays ryze*
*solo kills vladimir at level 6*
*gets camped by clubmate nidalee*
*they dive me 3 times*
*jungle zac never comes for the counter gank*
*jungle zac tells me to stop feeding*
_Day 239, I am defending the inhib. My team is still trying to 4 man dive bot lane. I see no end to this. Open mid._

I feel that the author truly captured the pain of this game and translated it perfectly. It really shows how an experienced player can shed so much light on that with which we are not yet familiar, or with that we couldn't describe before.

*plays zed*
*double kills at lvl 8 both mid viktor and jg yi*
*gets ganked by both top and bot AT THE SAME FRIKIN TIME*
*team top and bot dont MIA*
*gets ganked similarly 4 more times through the game, changing my score from 2/1/0 to to 2/5/0*
*teammates dont MIA every time*
*2/8/1 lucian in bot tells me to stop feeding*


FUCK YOU

Although IF they are putting pressure elsewhere it is your fault. You can get camped and not feed, and if they're getting mid and bot fed and getting your team dragons its better for the team.

if they aren't then yes it is their fault.

More like.. 

"Yo top quit feeding them."
"How about you get off your ass and help get rid of this camping jungler?"
"/all report top for feeding gg"
-they continue to farm Kruggs as it's 2v1 in top lane-

I don't understand how people feed in the first place. Is standing the fuck back at the edge of XP range, farming under your tower, and warding to avoid a dive *really* so difficult. If you're losing lane so hard, just stop trying to lane. I'd rather you be useless for 15 minutes and farm up later than be useless *and* turn one of the enemy champs into a god.

I think the best I've ever done when trying not to feed was 0/3 (under bad conditions) at twelve minutes, and that was super hard. Sometimes the enemy just has it out for you. Sometimes you get countered in lane, sometimes the enemy is simply better than you, other times you get camped and only your lane is ganked and the jungler is -always- there. You go to lane, get hit twice under tower and have to back or you'll die. Tower dives are a huge thing too. 

At that point, it's like... gank my lane. I don't care if we don't get a kill, just make them back with your presence so I can farm a single wave without dying. Granted, some people are just bad and don't understand how to stay under tower.

Not feeding your lane openent when they get ahead can be really hard. Good example of this are  {{champion:92}} {{champion:64}} {{champion:58}}. 
Renekton is my most played top laner of the three (dont play riven, find her boring, tend to leave lee in jungle) 

I have had many first bloods from lvl 1 or 2 playing renekton because its super easy in quite a few match ups. a lot of players expect you to use your fury on an empowerd q so you can bait them into an empowered w insted which destroys the HP especially in the early game, or they dont think you started with your q at lvl 1.
I pretty much always run, {{summoner:4}} {{summoner:12}} and grasp of undying on my toplaners. If you give me an early kill (lvl 1-2) i can pretty much gaurentee you can no longer lane effectively. Because by the time you have got back to lane, i have regained a lot of hp and now have 1-2 lvl advantage (depends if they took ignite or tp) and upon your arival back into lane, if you so much aproach the minion wave i am going straight for you. get a free trade with empowered W and empowerd Q  and e back out. your now left with about half hp, on top of being underleveld. Then if i freeze the lane you are screwed.


Some champs are just really good at getting fed in lane. but the single best piece of advice i can offer is that if you give away an early kill and cannot lane properly, stop building offensively immediately and build defensisvly. Because if you keep going offensive, its easier and easier for your oppenent to kill you. Because you can pretty much guarantee that if you give the early kill your opponent is more than likely to build some more damage. it sucks more if they are able to utilise {{item:3071}} {{item:3748}} as because they not only do more damage, they become harder to kill.


So please if you die early, for your own sake, pick up {{item:1029}} over another {{item:1036}} and buy your self HP potions and if you can buy a pink ward for your tri bush to give you some tower dive warning
My best attempt was a 0/1/0. Turned into a 1/1/4 at the end of the game.

resulting in a more ap and u need only 2 spell roations to kill your enemy midlaner

Me too happenes all the time so annoying they kill you once first 7min of the game they go back to base and they build trinity force and death cap like chill bro its been 7min and they haven't  killed one minion so annoying
What did you do to give them a Death Cap????
This is so true.  Sometimes my sarcasm spills into chat, though. I'm never sure if they get it.
Well you should lol
oh stop it. we all know you're going to keep feeding anyways.
Well, if you hear this too often, then maybe you have a problem. So don't be sarcastic towards people that tell you this, but try to improve instead.

this game has no way to improve Without the risk of feeding. there are bot games, but even a shit player like me can deal with them now. the only way to improve is to play against people better than you, but whenever you play against people better than you, you get stomped
And you can play it in normals, not enter a rank just to be burden for your team.
I just tell them that by telling me or the person to "stop feeding" you're implying that I/they are attempting to actually feed, which is pretty stupid.
This Food Is MINE And I Feed WHOMEVER I WANT 2
